meanings.definition: Incorrect use or application of something.
meanings.sent1: The misapplications of the new software caused many errors.
meanings.sent2: The misapplications of the safety guidelines led to accidents.
meanings.sent3: The misapplications of the recipe made the dish taste strange.
meanings.sent4: Her misapplications of the rules turned the game into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The misapplications of the paint colors created a messy mural.

meanings.definition: Mistakes in the way something is used or applied.
meanings.sent1: His misapplications of the tools resulted in broken equipment.
meanings.sent2: The misapplications of the budget led to financial problems.
meanings.sent3: The misapplications of the directions made the project a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: Their misapplications of the principles caused the plan to crumble.
meanings.sent5: The misapplications of the technology caused system failures.
